result.execSummary:
The defendant Troy J Mahl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation becomes revoked, the sentence may be served with huber.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Troy J Mahl

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Probation review hearing on May 2, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
11:34 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the Court.  Statement by Atty Privat.  Statement by defendant, requests to proceed.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  30 days county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 12 months.

CONDITIONS:

Court costs.
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

Court grants huber if served.  Sentence credit - 1 day.

Court adjourned at 11:40 a.m.

2:33 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites plea agreement - defendant will plea to the charge with imposed and stayed sentence.  DA concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Statement by defendant - requests more time to think about this.  Court will set for Plea & Sentencing on June 23, 2015 at 11:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 2:38 p.m.
No abusive or violent contact with defendant's mother.
No abusive or violent contact with defendant's mother.

2:53 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video frm the Green Lake County Jail with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty Privat enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  Defendant qualifies for PD representation.  Atty Privat will be representing.  Statement by the Court in regards to recusal.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  No abusive or violent contact with defendant's mother.    Court will set for Status Hearing on June 15, 2015 at 2:00p.m.

Court adjourned at 2:56 p.m.
